column5: Working weekends sucks. I have been begging for something like this closer to home for me, and finally we get it, and I can't make it out to it. What a bummer.  S.

Kids and I went for a few hours, they had a decent time.  They scored some what could be decent baits too.  I got a new set of bluewateroptics glasses that I an very impressed with so far and the price was in my range too.

Spoke to Mr "Handelbarz" himself for a bit (he's having problems getting on here from time to time like I was) and a few other folks as well.  We missed seeing JP and Big Jim speak but it was a bit funny to watch JP at the kids pond catching fish and passing the rod's off to the young ones. I did learn that this event came together in 4 weeks tops as they were planning this for next year, got all that worked out and then the LEX said, we have an opening if you think you can fill it let's do one now.  And that's why so few knew about it, last minute deal so to say...

We got there at 8:45 this morning they let us in then,we were told about it at the Bowmanville show.Left at 10:45.My son and my buddy got a new rod and reel from BJ Tackle.I got a new Enigma Phenom Titanium jigging rod from one of the dealers.and a few baits .Prices cheaper then if you bought at a store and of coarse no taxes.
Make sure you come say Hi! I'm in the Fishaholic booth.

Got some time shirts. Be seeing the Bluewater optics guy at Gagnon next week has some.parts for a 7 year old.pair of glasses that have been through a war. Show was OK some deals there on rods and reels if u look. Pro just has a Shimano extrude extrude extrude or some.name 100bux off no tax I left it there
It's open till 4 pm today for those looking for last minute deals on things they may not want to pack up and take back

Bought a Handlebarz spinner bait. He seemed to have some good prices. Wish there were more deals throughout. I was actually surprised at some of the prices on tackle. I can buy some of the product locally for a much better price than those being offered at the show. Nice to have a show close to home though. I did like the info on the Roughguard application for trucks. Will be looking into that.

So the people that manage the Toronto Fishing Show have put together a show in the Kawartha's. April 1-3rd at the Lindsay Exhibition.  Apparently there will be the mega tank and a trout pond!  Free entrance too.  Who's planning on going?
Really?  News to me but if so I'll be there Sat afternoon with my kids as it is a kids weekend for me.
Really?  News to me but if so I'll be there Sat afternoon with my kids as it is a kids weekend for me. I know it's April Fools day, but I'm not joking lol

Muskies Canada Inc., Kawartha Chapter will be there and we will be doing something special for the children this year. Along with education for the adults, the kids can learn how to build their own fishing lure called a "Go Getter".... This is a small inline spinner bait with small worm hook, and when they are done making it (choose their own colour of beads and blade) they get to keep it. Kind of a fun way to get them interested.  Hope to see a lot of folks out for this inaugural event.

Muskies Canada Inc., Kawartha Chapter will be there and we will be doing something special for the children this year. Along with education for the adults, the kids can learn how to build their own fishing lure called a "Go Getter".... This is a small inline spinner bait with small worm hook, and when they are done making it (choose their own colour of beads and blade) they get to keep it. Kind of a fun way to get them interested.  Hope to see a lot of folks out for this inaugural event. That's awesome!
I know it's April Fools day, but I'm not joking lol My thoughts too, but nope it's legit! http://www.lindsayex.com/events-list/2016/3/8/kawartha

http://kawarthasportsmenshow.com/ Parking and admission are free, JP DeRose and Big Jim McLaughlin will be there. Why not go? Help them get this thing off the ground. They haven't posted an exhibitor list yet, but I know for sure Mike Parker will be there with his Handlebarz Musky Lures to take some money off my hands. I'll be there tying go getters with Tom on Saturday.
Wow, this is news to me. Hope i can swing by.  S.

Yes I live 20mins away and just heard about it the other day !! They should advertise it a little better I guess and seeing how it's the first time being held would be great to see all the fishing related vendors from the area plus get the word out about their product !!!  I will def stop in and check it out as I do plan on getting my boat from storage next weekend but I'm sure I can find a few hours to check it out !!!!
If it wasn't a 2 hour drive I'd be there for sure. I hope this show gains the interest needed to have it run for years.
Should be a great show.  Nice to see something in the Kawartha's.
What time do they open on Sat.

What time do they open on Sat. right on the link I posted (and others) shows the following: Show Hours | Friday, April 1: 12:00 pm – 8:00 pm Saturday, April 2: 9:00 am – 6:00 pm Sunday, April 3: 10:00 am – 4:00 pm Admission | Free Admission for all ages! Parking | FREE! LOCATION | LEX – The Lindsay Exhibition

right on the link I posted (and others) shows the following: Show Hours | Friday, April 1: 12:00 pm – 8:00 pm Saturday, April 2: 9:00 am – 6:00 pm Sunday, April 3: 10:00 am – 4:00 pm Admission | Free Admission for all ages! Parking | FREE! LOCATION | LEX – The Lindsay Exhibition I must be blind in my old age as I cant see any times in the link you posted above.I can see the hours here Thanks.
Friday, April 1: 12:00 pm – 8:00 pmSaturday, April 2: 9:00 am – 6:00 pmSunday, April 3: 10:00 am – 4:00 pm

Just heard about it on the radio this morning. Last minute Lindsay! They have tried various types of fishing or sportsman shows over the years and none have continued. Hopefully this one is different. I should find time to stop into the show.

I must be blind in my old age as I cant see any times in the link you posted above.I can see the hours here Thanks. No worries  Just heard about it on the radio this morning. Last minute Lindsay! They have tried various types of fishing or sportsman shows over the years and none have continued. Hopefully this one is different. I should find time to stop into the show. I was planning on going after lunch on Sat with the kids.  I'll have my white WFN hat on for those going and 2 kids with me.  But from the looks of things I won't get able to get there till 4pm now

No worries  I was planning on going after lunch on Sat with the kids.  I'll have my white WFN hat on for those going and 2 kids with me.  But from the looks of things I won't get able to get there till 4pm now  Stop by the MCI booth....We would be happy to show the kids how to make their own lure which they get to keep.
Stop by the MCI booth....We would be happy to show the kids how to make their own lure which they get to keep. If I get the truck breaks fixed we will be there!
Directory of exhibitors is now online. http://kawarthasportsmenshow.com/exhibitor-directory/
my "sister" just said she's coming too so I should be there at 2pm on Sat
I ll be there not sure when, gonna get out for some fishin saturday
I ll be there not sure when, gonna get out for some fishin saturday Look for the kids, Nancy and me if between 2 and 5
Might go after work today.

Good little show I thought. Lots of fishing tackle on display.  Bought a ticket on the tractor. Talked to the fly fishing guys, may take up a new hobby this year. Got some good bear skinning tips from the taxidermist.
